questions.question: Which UNESCO site was the ancient ceremonial center of the Zapotec civilization located in modern-day Mexico?
questions.context: Founded around 500 BC, this site represents the oldest cities of Mesoamerica and offers panoramic views of the Oaxaca Valley.

questions.question: Which modern architectural marvel features the world's tallest observation deck and is located in the United Arab Emirates?
questions.context: Completed in 2010 and standing at over 828 meters tall, this skyscraper has reshaped the Dubai skyline and offers breathtaking views from its observation decks.

questions.question: Which historical battle site, located in Belgium, marked the end of Napoleon Bonaparte's rule in 1815?
questions.context: The Battle of Waterloo saw Britain and Prussia decisively defeating Napoleon, leading to his subsequent exile.

questions.question: Which famous museum, located in France, is home to the Mona Lisa and was once a royal palace?
questions.context: The world's largest and most-visited art museum, the Louvre holds over 380,000 objects and artifacts.

questions.question: What ancient ruin, located in Turkey, was considered one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World and was a foremost religious center dedicated to Artemis?
questions.context: Once located near present-day Selçuk, the temple was rebuilt three times before its final destruction in 401 AD.
